kinetic.client.advanced

Interface AdvancedKineticClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericKineticClient, KineticClient
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    KineticAdminClient, KineticP2pClient

    public interface AdvancedKineticClient
extends KineticClient
    The AdvancedKineticClient defines extended interfaces for PUT/DELETE operations.

    Applications use these interfaces to control when a PUT/GET operation should be synced/flushed to the persistent storage.

    The default persist option is set to SYNC if not specified.

    If FLUSH option is used and the operation is successfully returned (callback handler is invoked with SUCCESS status), all operations performed with ASYNC option are also 'synced' to the persistent store.

    Author:
    chiaming
    See Also:
    PersistOption

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        boolean delete(Entry entry,
             PersistOption option)
               throws KineticException
        Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry. Applications may also use other variations of this API to perform deletion of an entry. For example, KineticClient.deleteForced(byte[]) or KineticClient.deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), etc.

        Parameters:
        entry - the key in the object is used to find the associated entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        Returns:
        true if entry is found and deleted. Otherwise, return false.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler), deleteForcedAsync(byte[], PersistOption, CallbackHandler), KineticClient.deleteForced(byte[]), deleteForced(byte[], PersistOption), KineticClient.deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), deleteAsync(Entry, PersistOption, CallbackHandler)

      • deleteAsync

        void deleteAsync(Entry entry,
               PersistOption option,
               CallbackHandler<java.lang.Boolean> handler)
                 throws KineticException
        Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry asynchronously. The version specified in the entry metadata must match the one stored in the persistent storage. Otherwise, a KineticException is raised.
        Parameters:
        entry - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous delete operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.delete(Entry), KineticClient.deleteForced(byte[]), KineticClient.deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler), delete(Entry, PersistOption), deleteForcedAsync(byte[], PersistOption, CallbackHandler)

      • deleteForced

        boolean deleteForced(byte[] key,
                   PersistOption option)
                     throws KineticException
        Force to delete the entry in the store that is associated with the specified key ignoring the version information of the entry.

        Parameters:
        key - the key used to find the associated entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        Returns:
        true if operation is successfully returned from server. Server does not check if entry exists in store.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.delete(Entry), KineticClient.deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), KineticClient.deleteForcedAsync(byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • deleteForcedAsync

        void deleteForcedAsync(byte[] key,
                     PersistOption option,
                     CallbackHandler<java.lang.Boolean> handler)
                       throws KineticException
        Force delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the parameter asynchronously, ignoring the entry version stored in the persistent store.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous delete operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.delete(Entry), KineticClient.deleteAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), KineticClient.deleteForced(byte[])

      • put

        Entry put(Entry entry,
        byte[] newVersion,
        PersistOption option)
          throws KineticException
        Put the specified Entry entry to the persistent store. Replace the version in the store with the new version. If the version in the specified entry does not match the version stored in the persistent store, a KineticException is thrown.

        The specified entry is guaranteed to be persisted in the store if SYNC/FLUSH option is used and the call returns successfully.

        The entry may or may not be persisted successfully if an Exception is raised. Applications may retry the put() operation or use the get() operation to determine the state of the previous unsuccessful put() status.

        Applications may force put the entry with KineticClient.putForced(Entry) API. An existed entry in the store is over-written if the key matches the entry in the store.

        Applications may use asynchronous put operation to put entry asynchronously. The result of the asynchronous operation is delivered to the application's CallbackHandler.onSuccess() method.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be put to the persistent store.
        newVersion - the new version for the specified Entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        Returns:
        a shallow copy of the specified entry but the value of version in the entry metadata is set to the new version.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.putForced(Entry), KineticClient.putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), KineticClient.putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler), CallbackHandler, CallbackResult

      • putAsync

        void putAsync(Entry entry,
            byte[] newVersion,
            PersistOption option,
            CallbackHandler<Entry> handler)
              throws KineticException
        Put the versioned Entry asynchronously. If the version in the specified entry does not match the version stored in the persistent store, a KineticException is delivered to the callback instance.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        newVersion - new version for the entry.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        handler - callback handler for this operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.putForced(Entry), KineticClient.put(Entry, byte[]), KineticClient.putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler)

      • putForced

        Entry putForced(Entry entry,
              PersistOption option)
                throws KineticException
        Put the specified Entry to the persistent store. Force to overwrite the entry in the store if existed.

        The specified entry is guaranteed to be persisted in the store if SYNC/FLUSH option is used and the call returns successfully.

        The entry may or may not be persisted successfully if an Exception is raised. Applications may retry the put() operation or use the get() operation to determine the state of the previous put() status.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to be put to the persistent store.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        Returns:
        the same entry reference as specified in the parameter.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.put(Entry, byte[]), KineticClient.putForcedAsync(Entry, CallbackHandler), KineticClient.putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • putForcedAsync

        void putForcedAsync(Entry entry,
                  PersistOption option,
                  CallbackHandler<Entry> handler)
                    throws KineticException
        Force to put the specified Entry asynchronously. Overwrite the entry in the store if existed.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        option - instruct the service to perform SYNC/ASYNC/FLUSH operation.
        handler - callback handler for this operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.putForced(Entry), KineticClient.put(Entry, byte[]), KineticClient.putAsync(Entry, byte[], CallbackHandler)

      • getKeyRangeReversed

        java.util.List<byte[]> getKeyRangeReversed(byte[] startKey,
                                         boolean startKeyInclusive,
                                         byte[] endKey,
                                         boolean endKeyInclusive,
                                         int maxKeys)
                                           throws KineticException
        Get a list of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range. The returned keys are sorted in reversed order.
        Parameters:
        startKey - the start key in the specified key range.
        startKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        endKey - the end key in the specified key range.
        endKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        maxKeys - max number of keys can be returned.
        Returns:
        a list of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range. If maxKeys is larger than the number of keys in the range, only the number of keys in the range will be returned. If the number of keys in the range is larger than maxKeys, then only maxKeys keys will be returned.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        getKeyRangeReversedAsync(byte[], boolean, byte[], boolean, int, CallbackHandler)

      • getKeyRangeReversedAsync

        void getKeyRangeReversedAsync(byte[] startKey,
                            boolean startKeyInclusive,
                            byte[] endKey,
                            boolean endKeyInclusive,
                            int maxKeys,
                            CallbackHandler<java.util.List<byte[]>> handler)
                              throws KineticException
        Get a List of keys in the sequence based on the specified key range in a reversed order asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        startKey - the start key in the specified key range.
        startKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        endKey - the end key in the specified key range.
        endKeyInclusive - true if the start key is inclusive.
        maxKeys - max number of keys to be returned for this operation.
        handler - the callback handler for the asynchronous getKeyRange operation.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        KineticClient.getKeyRange(byte[], boolean, byte[], boolean, int)
